did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Afrika Bambaataa hip hop archive, circa 1972-2016.
did.physdesc: Vinyl records and other A/V Recordings, Financial Records, Manuscripts, Memorabilia, Photocopies, Photographs, Printed Materials, Publications.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Approximately 40,000 sound recordings representing Bambaataa's music collection from the 1970s to the present. The archive also includes books, documents, and files relating to the founding and spread of the Universal Zulu Nation; and videos, papers, and clothing.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Afrika Bambaataa is an American disc jockey, singer, and songwriter from the South Bronx, New York. Often called the “Godfather” of Hip Hop, Bambaataa has helped to define Hip Hop since it emerged in the South Bronx in the 1970s. One of a handful of Hip Hop's 1970s originators, Bambaataa gave Hip Hop its name, and was the first to define its core artistic elements - DJing, rapping, break dancing, and graffiti art - under one cultural umbrella. His cultural organization, the Universal Zulu Nation, has helped to spread Hip Hop culture throughout the world. His genre-defining 1982 song "Planet Rock" and subsequent electro-funk tracks have become icons of hip-hop and electronic music. In 2007 he was nominated for induction into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Approximately 40,000 sound recordings representing Bambaataa's music collection from the 1970s to the present. The archive also includes books, documents, and files relating to the founding and spread of the Universal Zulu Nation; and videos, papers, and clothing.

controlaccess.geogname: Bronx (New York, N.Y.) -- Social conditions -- 20th century.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to collection restricted until completion of processing, with the exception of vinyl records that have been individually cataloged.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p:
Vinyl that has been cataloged can be viewed but not played. Due to the fragility and potential degradation of moving image and sound recordings, viewing and listening is limited to items that have been digitized. If an item is in another media format, you may request to have the item digitized for access. Information on ordering access copies may be found on the Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections webpage.
Audio visual media that has been digitized: SR-6803, SR-6889, SR-8036, SR-8807, SR-8808, SR-8810 to SR-8816, SR-8818 to SR-8825, SR-10341 to SR-10370.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Afrika Bambaataa Hip Hop Archive, #8094. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

processinfo.p: Titles taken from the labels, but altered slightly to create consistency. When information on label is incorrect (verified after digitization) the title as been altered and there is a Scope and Content note. Digitized not reviewed indicates that the metadata in the record has not been validated by the digitized video.

did.unittitle: Million Youth March in Harlem, New York

did.unittitle: Sixteenth Universal Zulu Nation Anniversary (part 2 Saturday); Dance and music performance by Angola Capoeira from Brazil and the Rock Steady Crew ; Rock Steady Crew b-boys dancing.

scopecontent.p: First part is performances by various well-known MCs and hip-hop groups including Brand Nubian as part of the UZN Hip Hop Anniversary. Second part is a separate event, a dance performance by the Rock Steady Crew and Angola Capoeira. Last part is verious clips of b-boys dancing circa 1995.

did.unittitle: Twenty-fifth Universal Zulu Nation Anniversary

scopecontent.p: Contains presentation of awards; DJing by Afrika Bambaataa, Jazzy Jay and others; performances by MCs and hip hop groups including the Cold Crush Brothers.

did.unittitle: Seventeenth Universal Zulu Nation Anniversary

scopecontent.p: Raw footage of interviews with attendees by Michael Berman, possibly for a show "On Camera Off Camera." Interviewees include Zulu Nation members Ahmed Henderson and Mr. Biggs, Bro Arthur K, Jalil from the group Whodini, Crazy Legs and others from the Rock Steady Crew, Mercury from the Force MDs, Screamin Rachael, Grand Master Flash, and Flava Flav, plus footage of performances.

scopecontent.p: Music and dancing, performance by Lovebug Starski, KRS-One, Biz Markie, Jungle Brothers.

scopecontent.p: Afrika Bambaataa and Family (2 other MC's) perform "Reckless" and he does call and response with the crowd. Seems to be a broadcast of a competition or an awards ceremony with other acts also performing. Slightly different broadcast from V-9954. Digitized as file RMM08094_V09955.

did.unittitle: Hip Hop concert live in Dallas, TX, 1990; Sixteenth Universal Zulu Nation Anniversary

scopecontent.p: First half of tape contains hip hop concert live in Dallas, TX with performances by Special Ed, Slick Rick, Big Daddy Kane, Busy Bee, and L.L. Cool J. 16th Zulu Nation Anniversary: Arthur 4x, Melle Mel, Strickly Connitto, Lord Finesse, DJ Fashion, DJ Jazzy Jay, Ikey C, Ultra Magnetic, Tricky Tee, Queen Mother Rage, Kid Jaz, Just Ice, You and I, Yambu.

scopecontent.p: Live performance by Afrika Bambaataa & Soulsonic Force. Bambaataa material first 44 minutes, the remainder is television. Only Bambaataa material was digitized.

scopecontent.p: Compilation of Bambaataa music videos and European shows featuring hip hop including Afrika Bambaataa perfomring "Reckless" on Azzurro 88 (Italian TV show), Bambaataa featured in Nescafe commercials, graffiti artist Brim Fuentes on British TV, documentary about hip hop, and more.

scopecontent.p: Behind the scenes of the recording of Unity with Bambaataa and James Brown. Includes Brown being interviewed by Entertainment Tonight. Second half of tape is Bambaataa interviewed and other videos on MTV.

did.unittitle: Beat This!: a Hip Hop history

scopecontent.p: Tape starts with "Beat This" documentary (1984) although it's labeled "Bombin'". Description of "Bombin"--Hip Hop History Bombin' (made for European TV): Afrika Bambaataa, Kook Herc, Cold Crush Brothers, Lisa Lee, Sha-Rock, Soulsonic Force, Jazzy Jay, Brim, Bio. Made for European TV.
